sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Serious observations lately made, touching his Majesty Charles the Second, King of England, Scotland,France & Ireland. King Charles Stuart, in Hebrew thus: [Hebrew] translated into English, is thus, the King hath prepared a refreshing, hee hath crushed it out of the rock by degrees. Published to inform the people, per H. Walker. S.S.T.S. Walker, Henry, Ironmonger.
[2], 6 p.
printed for R.I. and are to bee sold by William Gilbertson at the Bible in Gilt-spur-street, London : 1660.
Annotations on Thomason copy: "Aug: 6"; following "Walker" in author statement: "Ironmonger". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

King Charles Stuart, in Hebrew thus: [Hebrew] translated into English, is thus, the King hath prepared a refreshing, hee hath crushed it out of the rock by degrees. Published to inform the people, per H. Walker. S.S.T.S. Walker, Henry, Ironmonger.
[2], 6 p.
printed for R.I. and are to bee sold by William Gilbertson at the Bible in Gilt-spur-street, London : 1660.
Annotations on Thomason copy: "Aug: 6"; following "Walker" in author statement: "Ironmonger". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
William Gilbertson
R.I.
the Bible in Gilt-spur-street
